definition: to flog/to lash/to whip/to urge or goad along
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: Nowadays，it is an inhumane punishment to flog the disobedient soldiers of sailors.
sentences.chinese: 今天，鞭笞抗命士兵或水手是不人道的惩罚。

sentences.english: TYPICAL USE:Nowadays, it is an inhumane punishment to flog the disobedient soldiers or sailers.
sentences.chinese: 先进，鞭笞不服从的兵士或水手是不人道的惩罚。

sentences.english: Judgments are prepared for scorners: and striking hammers for the bodies of fools.
sentences.chinese: 体刑是为轻狂人而设，鞭笞是为愚人背而备。

sentences.english: That succeeded in whipping-up some ugly elements in the Republican party.
sentences.chinese: 这些指控成功的鞭笞了共和党中一些丑恶的元素。

sentences.english: If Ross fell asleep, the baby's mother whipped her.
sentences.chinese: 假如萝丝不慎睡著了，婴儿的妈妈会鞭笞她。

sentences.english: Outside, waves pound the white sand beach, a hot wind whips the water.
sentences.chinese: 外面，波涛拍打着白砂沙滩，热风鞭笞着海水。

sentences.english: Any animal caught singing it was given a flogging on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 任何唱这歌的动物都会当场受到鞭笞。

sentences.english: I want the beating palms to cry out for Samson.
sentences.chinese: 我要那鞭笞用的棕榈，来为参孙放声痛哭。

sentences.english: Nowadays, it is an inpeoplee punishment to flog the disobedient soldiers ofsailors.
sentences.chinese: 当今，鞭笞抗命士兵或水手是不人道的惩罚。

sentences.english: Do you fear the  slash of the rain?
And let him who would lash the offender look unto the spirit of the offended.
sentences.chinese: 让鞭笞犯罪者的人也审视那受害者的灵魂。

sentences.english: Improved Lash of Pain (Destruction) and Improved Firebolt (Destruction) have been merged into one talent, Demonic Power.
sentences.chinese: 强化痛苦鞭笞以及强化小鬼合并，更名为恶魔之力。

sentences.english: In old days, teachers were used to cane the pupils as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 从前，教师常鞭笞学生作惩罚。

sentences.english: It is enough for me to recall the flogging of peasants.
sentences.chinese: 只要回忆起农民被鞭笞的事就叫我够受的了。

sentences.english: For example, a false start of a running event might have been followed by a whipping of the violator.
sentences.chinese: 例如，赛跑比赛的偷跑者可能会受到鞭笞的惩罚。

sentences.english: You can't just whip them around and go in another direction.
sentences.chinese: 你不能只是依靠不断鞭笞他们来走上另一个方向。

definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
